sub_title: Visiting Researcher | International Security | Foreign Policy Analysis
summary:
I am incredibly passionate about politics, international relations, and security. My expertise lies in International Order, Great Power Competition, Transatlantic Security, and European and Euro-Atlantic Integration. Over the course of my career, I have worked with numerous NGOs, where I have managed projects and events, analyzed international affairs, and established strong external relationships. Thanks to these experiences, I have acquired diverse skills that have been instrumental in advancing my career.

Furthermore, I had the opportunity to intern with the MFA of Ukraine, where I gained first-hand experience in the workings of a governmental institution and honed my analytical skills and understanding of diplomacy. I was fortunate enough to have an internship with a French tech start-up company Nunki that specializes in AI and OSINT. This experience provided me with valuable insights into how technology can support international security analysis and data collection.

I am a reliable team player and possess excellent critical thinking skills that I have developed through various experiences. My writing skills improved significantly as I wrote analytical pieces for The New Global Order and Transatlantic Dialogue Center, covering topics related to EU affairs, transatlantic defence and security and Russian invasion of Ukraine. I am always open to collaborating with other authors and research institutions. 

Finally, I am highly motivated to connect with international affairs and security experts to establish a dynamic network that advances our mutual interests and has a positive impact on the world.
